title: Ulysses

first-published.note: full book version; magazine serialization began in 1918

cover.description: Cover of 1922 Shakespeare and Company edition.
cover.alt: Light blue cover with ULYSSES in large white type centered near the top, and 'BY JAMES JOYCE' centered in smaller white type near the bottom.

overview: While this novel is now widely praised (and was selected by the Modern Library as the best novel of the 20th century), it was barred from the United States and some other countries for years, even before the book was published in full.

incidents.description: At the urging of John Sumner of the New York Society for the Suppresssion of Vice, the US Postal Service seized copies of 'The Little Review', a magazine that was printing installments of <cite>Ulysses</cite>.  A court ruled that the novel was obscene the following year, effectively banning its publication in the US. After years of intense advocacy for the book, the federal court for the Southern District of the New York lifted the ban in 1933, and an appeals court upheld that decision in 1934.
